page.title: 14EYEMOUTH MUSEUM
page.content: This small folk-museum was opened in October 1981,as a memorial to the local fishermen who lost their lives in the Great Fishing Disaster of 1881.It records the history of the town and surrounding area and is housed in what was formerly the old parish church in the centre of the town.Exhibits include a Victorian shop window,a fisherman's cottage as it was 100 years ago and many of the tools used in local industries and farming over the past 100 years.Special exhibitions are held regularly and local schoolchildren are encouraged to carry out project research within the museum.The museum contains the 15ft long Eyemouth Tapestry,worked by local women to commemorate the Disaster.It took 2 years to sew and has 400 different shades of wool.
